00045 struct harvardContactStruct
00046 {
00047         //dof at contact
00048         double joint_val;
00049 
00050         // is this structure initialized ?
00051         bool init;
00052 
00053         // contact distance 
00054         double a;
00055 
00056         // angle at contact
00057         double psi_cont;
00058 
00059         // dof * joint_ratio = apparent angle
00060         double joint_ratio;
00061 
00062         // normal wrt world coords
00063         vec3 world_normal;
00064 
00065         // tangent wrt body coords
00066         vec3 world_tangent;
00067 
00068         // normal wrt body coords
00069         vec3 body_normal;
00070 
00071         // tangent wrt body coords
00072         vec3 body_tangent;
00073 
00074         harvardContactStruct()
00075         {
00076                 init=0;
00077                 a=0;
00078         }
00079         void set_vals(bool tinit,
00080                         vec3 bn,
00081                         vec3 bt,
00082                         vec3 wn,
00083                         vec3 wt,
00084                         double ta, 
00085                         double jr,
00086                         double psi)
00087         {
00088                 init=tinit;
00089                 body_normal=bn;
00090                 body_tangent=bt;
00091                 world_normal=wn;
00092                 world_tangent=wt;
00093                 a=ta;
00094                 joint_ratio=jr;
00095                 psi_cont=psi;
00096         }
00097 };

00178         inline static double rad2deg(double angle)
00179         {
00180                 return 57.2957795*angle;
00181         }
00182         inline static double deg2rad(double angle)
00183         {
00184                 return angle/57.2957795;
00185         }

00199           double HarvardHand::current_unbalanced_force(double tmp_dof);
00200 
00201           // define a vector to store all the intermediate forces
00202           // that we calculate. This vector has maximum of 8 elements (corresponding
00203           // to the 8 times contacts can be made. Every element of bforces
00204           // (bforces stands for body-forces) must have 2 forces, fn1 and fn2
00205           // (refer to writeup). Each of fn1 and fn2 is a vec3. We will be 
00206           // pushing new values into bforces with the push_back routine.
00207           std::vector< std::vector< vec3 > > bforces;
